title: Forward Propagation
subtitle: Univariate Regression
contentHtml:
• The first step of gradient descent is to compute the loss. To do this, define your model’s output and loss function. In this regression setting, we use the mean squared error loss.
ŷ =wx+b=1m||ŷ −y||2y^=wx+bL=1m||y^−y||2
contentMarkdown:
*   The first step of gradient descent is to compute the loss. To do this, define your model’s output and loss function. In this regression setting, we use the mean squared error loss.

ŷ \=wx+b\=1m||ŷ −y||2y^\=wx+bL\=1m||y^−y||2

title: Backward Propagation
subtitle: Univariate Regression
contentHtml:
• The next step is to compute the local gradient of the loss with respect to the parameters (i.e. ww and bb). This means you need to calculate derivatives. Note that values stored during the forward propagation are used in the gradient equations.
∂∂w∂∂b=2m(ŷ −y)x⊺=2m(ŷ −y)1⃗ ∂L∂w=2m(y^−y)x⊺∂L∂b=2m(y^−y)1→
contentMarkdown:
*   The next step is to compute the local gradient of the loss with respect to the parameters (i.e. www and bbb). This means you need to calculate derivatives. Note that values stored during the forward propagation are used in the gradient equations.

∂∂w∂∂b\=2m(ŷ −y)x⊺\=2m(ŷ −y)1⃗ ∂L∂w\=2m(y^−y)x⊺∂L∂b\=2m(y^−y)1→

title: Forward Propagation
subtitle: Multivariate Regression
contentHtml: ŷ =wX+b=1m||ŷ −y||2y^=wX+bL=1m||y^−y||2

title: Backward Propagation
subtitle: Multivariate Regression
contentHtml: ∂∂w∂∂b=2m(ŷ −y)X⊺=2m(ŷ −y)1⃗ ∂L∂w=2m(y^−y)X⊺∂L∂b=2m(y^−y)1→

title: Forward Propagation
subtitle: Two Layer Linear Network
contentHtml: Zŷ =W1X+b1=w2Z+b2=1m||ŷ −y||2Z=W1X+b1y^=w2Z+b2L=1m||y^−y||2

title: Backward Propagation
subtitle: Two Layer Linear Network
contentHtml: ∂∂W1∂∂b1∂∂w2∂∂b2=w⊺22m(ŷ −y)X⊺=w⊺22m(ŷ −y)1⃗ =2m(ŷ −y)Z⊺=2m(ŷ −y)1⃗ ∂L∂W1=w2⊺2m(y^−y)X⊺∂L∂b1=w2⊺2m(y^−y)1→∂L∂w2=2m(y^−y)Z⊺∂L∂b2=2m(y^−y)1→

title: Forward Propagation
subtitle: Two Layer Nonlinear Network
contentHtml: ZAŷ =W1X+b1=σ(Z)=w2A+b2=1m||ŷ −y||2Z=W1X+b1A=σ(Z)y^=w2A+b2L=1m||y^−y||2

title: Backward Propagation
subtitle: Two Layer Nonlinear Network
contentHtml: ∂∂W1∂∂b1∂∂w2∂∂b2=((w⊺22m(ŷ −y))⊙A⊙(1−A))X⊺=((w⊺22m(ŷ −y))⊙A⊙(1−A))1⃗ =2m(ŷ −y)A⊺=2m(ŷ −y)1⃗ ∂L∂W1=((w2⊺2m(y^−y))⊙A⊙(1−A))X⊺∂L∂b1=((w2⊺2m(y^−y))⊙A⊙(1−A))1→∂L∂w2=2m(y^−y)A⊺∂L∂b2=2m(y^−y)1→
